Package space.sunqian.common.dynamic.aspect

Interface AspectHandler

All Known Subinterfaces:
InjectedAspect
public interface AspectHandler
The AspectHandler is an interface used to handle aspect-oriented programming, including determining whether a method needs to apply aspect (needsAspect(Method)) and the specific behavior of the target advised method (beforeInvoking(Method, Object[], Object), afterReturning(Object, Method, Object[], Object) and afterThrowing(Throwable, Method, Object[], Object)).

This interface is typically used for AspectMaker.make(Class, AspectHandler).

    This method will be invoked before the invocation of the target method.
    boolean
    needsAspect(@Nonnull Method method)
    Returns whether the aspect-oriented programming should be applied to the given method.

  • Method Details

    • needsAspect

      boolean needsAspect(@Nonnull @Nonnull Method method)
      Returns whether the aspect-oriented programming should be applied to the given method.

      Typically, the AspectMaker invokes this method for each aspect-able method of the class which applies the aspect, only once.

      Parameters:
      method - the given method
      Returns:
      whether the aspect-oriented programming should be applied to the given method

    • beforeInvoking

      void beforeInvoking(@Nonnull @Nonnull Method method, Object @Nonnull [] args, @Nonnull @Nonnull Object target) throws Throwable
      This method will be invoked before the invocation of the target method.
      Parameters:
      method - the target method being intercepted (advised)
      args - the arguments passed to the target method, changes to the array elements will propagate to the target method
      target - the target object which the advised method belongs to, may be a proxy instance itself
      Throws:
      Throwable - any exception thrown by the invocation

    • afterReturning

      @Nullable @Nullable Object afterReturning(@Nullable @Nullable Object result, @Nonnull @Nonnull Method method, Object @Nonnull [] args, @Nonnull @Nonnull Object target) throws Throwable
      This method will be invoked after the invocation of the target method. The original return value of the target method will be replaced by the returned value of this method as the final return value.
      Parameters:
      result - the original result of the invocation of the target method, may be null
      method - the target method being intercepted (advised)
      args - the arguments passed to the target method, changes to the array elements will propagate to the afterThrowing(Throwable, Method, Object[], Object)
      target - the target object which the advised method belongs to, may be a proxy instance itself
      Returns:
      the final return value
      Throws:
      Throwable - any exception thrown by the invocation

    • afterThrowing

      @Nullable @Nullable Object afterThrowing(@Nonnull @Nonnull Throwable ex, @Nonnull @Nonnull Method method, Object @Nonnull [] args, @Nonnull @Nonnull Object target)
      This method is used to handle the exception thrown by all pre-invocations, including the invocation of the target method, beforeInvoking(Method, Object[], Object) and afterReturning(Object, Method, Object[], Object). The return value of this method will be the final return value.
      Parameters:
      ex - the exception thrown by all pre-invocations
      method - the target method being intercepted (advised)
      args - the arguments passed to the target method, may be changed by pre-invocations
      target - the target object which the advised method belongs to, may be a proxy object
      Returns:
      the final return value
